names.english: dang gui, peony and rehmannia decoction
names.commonEnglish: Dang Gui, Peony and Rehmanniae Decoction

actions: Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold and alleviates pain.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
Nourishes the Blood, astringes Yin, adjusts the Ying and Wei, softens the Liver and relieves pain.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
With Gui Zhi, harmonizes the Ying and Wei.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood and nourishes Yin.
With Bai Shao, for Blood Deficiency Heat.
Induces sweating, expels Wind-Dampness, strongly dries Dampness and tonifies the Spleen.
Relaxes the sinews, increases Qi and Blood circulation, unblocks the channels, harmonizes the Stomach, nourishes the Liver and transforms Dampness.
With Dang Gui and Bai Shao, for Blood Deficiency causing muscle spasms.
Clears Heat, cools and harmonizes the Blood, clears Deficiency Fire, invigorates the Blood and dispels Blood Stasis.
With Sheng Di Huang, for a residual Warm pathogen which has injured the Yin.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and strengthens the Spleen.

With Ze Xie, facilitates the removal of water and leaches out Dampness to treat stagnant water and Dampness leading to edema, jaundice, diarrhea, Milky Lin, and scanty, difficult urination with abdominal distention.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and drains Kidney Fire.
With Mu Dan Pi, for steaming bone disorder, dizziness and vertigo.
Invigorates the Blood, expels Blood Stasis, nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin, strengthens the sinews and bones and benefits the joints.
With Sheng Di Huang, powerfully clears Deficiency Fire.
Promotes urination and clears Damp-Heat.
With Ze Xie, for Lin syndrome, edema and distention.
With Niu Xi, for Kidney Deficiency edema.
With Cang Zhu, for Damp-Heat vaginal discharge with Spleen Deficiency.

Releases the Exterior, assists Yang, adjusts the Ying and Wei, releases the muscle layer, warms and facilitates the flow of Qi through the channels and collaterals and Blood through the vessels and relieves pain.
With Bai Shao, for External Wind-Cold with disharmony between the Ying and Wei including spontaneous sweating, fever and chills.
With Fu Ling, unblocks Yang and facilitates the removal of congested fluids associated with Yang Deficiency edema.
Dispels Wind-Dampness, unblocks the channels and alleviates pain.
With Niu Xi, for Wind-Damp Bi causing joint pain, especially in the lower joints.
Dispels Wind, eliminates Dampness,invigorates the Blood, unblocks the collaterals and relaxes the sinews.
Cools the Blood
Clears Blood Heat
Nourishes and invigorates the Blood
Releases the Exterior
Expels Wind-Dampness
Alleviates pain
syndromes: Severe Wind-Cold or Heat and Dampness with Blood Deficiency

symptoms: Joint redness, swelling, Heat and pain
Initially the pain eases when exposed to coolness
Later, coolness does not help. but warmth does
Sweating with little or no exertion
manifestations.tongueCoat: White or Yellow or Slimy and yellow
